note.p: The aim of the author is to describe the 'traditional pronunciation' and not the most recent development of /q/, therefore he chooses older informants who could provide information on the reflex of /q/ through their dialects, that is the dialects which existed before the independence of Tunisia caused a more frequent occurrence of mixed dialects.
